name: "Top Gun" General Knowledge Quiz / Test | Top Gun . | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the aircraft carrier that we see in both the beginning and ending of "Top Gun"?
questions.explanation:
USS Enterprise.

	The USS Alabama and USS Missouri were both Battleships in WWII.  The original USS Enterprise was an Aircraft Carrier in WWII and was decomissioned in the 50's.

Tony Scott.

	Jerry Bruckheimer and Don Simpson are the producers of "Top Gun".  Ron Shelton didn't start directing major motion pictures until 1988.  Although his first film did have one of the actors from "Top Gun" as one of its stars.  "Top Gun" was Tony Scott's second film.  He has since gone on to direct a number of top films.

questions.text: What is the name of the aircraft the Maverick flies throughout "Top Gun"?
questions.explanation:
F-14.

	The F-5 and A-4 are used as Mig simulators.

Tim Robbins.

	Tim has since gone on to star in major films such as "Bull Durham", "The Hudsucker Proxy", and "Mission to Mars".

questions.text: Who said, "I'm gonna break high and right, and see if he's really alone."
questions.explanation:
Cougar.

	Cougar said this to Maverick as they were approaching what they thought was one enemy fighter plane.  They found out that is was actually two and the opening battle was on.

questions.text: Someone actually died during the making of "Top Gun"?
questions.explanation:
True.

	Art Scholl was killed while filming the "flat spin" scene in which Goose dies.

Meg Ryan.

	"Top Gun" had quite a few actors that were just starting out in major films.

questions.text: What body of water does the opening scene take place over?
questions.explanation:
Indian Ocean.

	Just after the opening credits are finished, at the bottom of the screen, it tells you that it is in the Indian Ocean and it is present day.

questions.text: The enemy aircraft in the opening scene is called a "Mig-29"?
questions.explanation:
False.

	It is actually called a "Mig-28."

Paramount Studios.

	Paramount has also released such movies as "Titanic", "Mission Impossible 2", and "We Were Soldiers".
